Package fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing

Interfaces for translating text into graph entities. These are Tokenizers and Parsers.

The role of Tokenizers is to process text lines representing a graph and transform them into a list of tokens that are meaningful for graph building. The role of Parsers is to take a list of tokens they are able to understand and transform it into an instance of a graph.

The way these classes work, basically, is:

For omugi text files, PreTokenizer checks the file for the type of content (tree, graph or treegraph); it then pre-processes the file (removing comments etc.) and instantiates the matching tokenizer. GraphTokenizer, TreeTokenizer, and TreeGraphTokenizer, transform the text lines into an internal representation of graph/tree elements (tokens). PreTokenizer also returns the matching parser.

The ReferenceTokenizer analyses Strings describing a location in a tree, using a hierarchical syntax.

Parsers take a Tokenizer at construction and return the proper type of graph matching the list of tokens returned by the tokenizer.

Jacques Gignoux - 20 ao√ªt 2021
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    TextGrammar
    This interface defines the conventions used to save graph elements as text.
    Tokenizer
    An interface for tokenizers of text files containing graph or tree data
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    LineTokenizer
    An abstract ancestor for tokenizers based on multi-line text.
    Parser
    An interface for parsers transforming a list of tokens built by a Tokenizer into a graph.
    PreTokenizer
    This class is a utility which, given a file in the omugi format,
    ValidPropertyTypes
    This class records the property types which are compatible with a given application using SimplePropertyList implementations.
